SMW Subobject for UnchargedHigh Alchemy value: 12624Buy limit: 10000Examine: You will need to recharge the bracelet at the Legends Guild.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Combat braceletImage: File:Combat bracelet (uncharged).pngUses infobox: ItemWeight: 0.250Value: 21040Version anchor: UnchargedRelease date: 30 April 2007Item ID: 11126

The combat bracelet is a dragonstone bracelet enchanted by the spell Lvl-5 Enchant.

A combat bracelet can be recharged at the totem pole in the Legends' Guild, at the Fountain of Uhld, or by casting Recharge Dragonstone, giving it four charges. Players who have completed Legends' Quest can also recharge it at the Fountain of Rune, giving it six charges.

The bracelet provides useful teleports to combat-related guilds. The bracelet also informs its wearer of their current Slayer task count every 10 kills (i.e. "You still need to kill x0 monsters to complete your current Slayer assignment"). This feature only works if the bracelet is charged.

The bracelet also provides combat bonuses comparable to those of mithril gloves from the Culinaromancer's Chest. Compared to mithril gloves, the bracelet has +1 attack bonuses and -1 defensive bonuses in all attack styles except magic.

  1. Manual casting is 3 ticks, auto-casting is 7 ticks

Teleportation options[edit | edit source]

Players can access the teleports by either right-clicking the bracelet in their inventory and selecting "rub", or right-clicking it while equipped and selecting one of their destinations. The bracelet has a maximum of 4 charges when charged in the Legends' Guild and 6 charges when charged at the Fountain of Rune. Each teleport consumes one of the bracelet's charges.

Destination Map
Warriors' Guild
Champions' Guild
Edgeville Monastery
Ranging Guild

The Combat bracelet is useful when travelling in the Wilderness, as teleports from dragonstone jewellery will work up to level 30 Wilderness, while most other means of teleportation will not work above level 20 Wilderness.

Price per teleport[edit | edit source]

Below is a table that shows the current price, price per teleport, the money loss after selling the uncharged bracelet, and finally the cost per teleport after adjusting for selling the uncharged bracelet.

Item Bracelet Cost Total Loss Cost Per Teleport

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
31 August 2017
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item could now be turned into bank placeholders.

9 February 2017
(update)

The uncharged version was made darker to distinguish it from charged versions.

26 February 2015
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item were made untradeable on the Trading Post/Grand Exchange.

27 March 2014
(update)

You can now recharge dragonstone jewellery at the Fountain of Rune.
